intro: Tocoyena lychnophora, commonly known as the candlewood plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Tocoyena lychnophora is also valued for its air-purifying properties and is relatively low maintenance once established.
